intro: Photinia bergerae, commonly known as the pink-leaf photinia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including countries such as Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its attractive, glossy, pinkish-red foliage, which changes with the seasons. It produces small white flowers in spring, followed by red berries in the autumn. Photinia bergerae is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and adaptability to various soil conditions.
